content.description: Super fun laybacks and jambs take you up this gently overhanging crack, some of the patina edges at the top are very positive but seemed a little thin and delicate so use cation. Good landing.
content.location:
The Lighthouse Area

This climb is located on the east side of the boulder, starts below large 'Y' shaped crack system on a slightly overhanging face.

content.description: Sit start in the hole, on the flake.  Throw up and left to a rail.  Delicately extract yourself from the hole and cruise up the face to the top out.  Crux is trying not to dab when moving out of the hole.  One move wonder.
content.location: South face of the BBC boulder, in the Lighthouse area.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start on the flake.  Follow shallow pockets up the slab.  You will definitely feel exposed at the top!
content.location: Just down the hill and slightly North of the Cromen.  See pic.

content.description: Start in the middle of the slab and head up and right, reaching the arete where it meets the flake.  Continue up the arete to the top.
content.location: Warmup area.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start on arete.  R hand in pocket, L hand in low sidepull crack.  L foot has a good foot-jam, R foot smear.  Bump up with alternating hands then mantle onto the slab and top out.  Don't blow a fuse! Much more strenuous than it looks, if you do the sit start.
content.location: NW arete of Circuit boulder.  See pic.

content.description: Start in the middle of the slab and head directly up, mantle onto the suspect flake (if you dare) and continue to the apex of the boulder.  You had better hope the death flake (sleigh) doesn't take you for a ride; tread lightly.  This would be a total classic if the flake didn't sound so hollow.
content.location: Warmup area.  The direct route up the center of the slab.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start on edges.  Move up flakes to good undercling, then a few crimps to an easy top out.
content.location: Right side of Warmup area.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start on jug.  Throw right to arete, left into undercling, then work your way up to the topout.  Fun!
content.location: Southwest arete of Circuit boulder.  See pic.

content.description: Start at the base of the slab.  Pull up onto the side of the boulder and traverse upwards.  Your upper hand is bumping along the arete and lower hand used as undercling on the bottom of the boulder.  Utilize crimps, jugs, underclings, and a hand jam to the traverse up the side of the boulder, to the top, eventually mantling onto the top of the boulder at the apex.  See pic.  Fun!
content.location: Warmup area.  See pic.

content.description: An awkward sit start takes you up into a cool pocket right on the arete, tops out left of the arete.
content.location:
The Cromen Area

This is the first boulder you come to in The Cromen Area, and is about 50 yards south of the large Y Not boulder

content.description: Sit start on lowest rail, pull up over bulge, then continue to the top on jugs.  Difficult downclimb.
content.location: East side of Red River boulder.  In Circuit area.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start.  Move up arete and top out on jugs.
content.location: Right arete of the Warmup Area.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start, right fingers in a nice pocket, left hand on arete.  Bear hug your way up the "fridge" to a reachy top out.
content.location: Castle area, just west of Iron Maiden.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start with L hand undercling and R hand slot.  Work up and right.
content.location: East face of Circuit boulder.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start with easy laybacking up a R facing corner.  When the crack ends you get will get smacked with the business (the lie);  bad crimps and a couple slopers.  Once you snag the top, it's an easy finish.
content.location: E side of Y Not boulder.  See pic.

content.description: Stand start down on the ground, mantle onto the slab and slab climb up the face adjacent to the arete (using the arete for left hands and feet) to the the apex of the boulder.
content.location: Warmup area.  See pic.

content.description: Starts in a shallow slopey pocket for your left hand and a positive quarter pad crimp for your right. Big moves takes you straight up the right side of a large black streak on this tall gently overhanging sandstone face
content.location:
Anything But Bland Area

8 foot to the right of Anything But Bland on the right side of large black streak.

content.description: Sit start.  Cruise up beautiful jugs and top out the boulder.  Also can be used as the downclimb for the area.
content.location: North side of the BBC boulder, in the Lighthouse area.  See pic.

content.description: Like the medieval Iron Maiden, looks terrifying but is mostly for show and not actually meant to torture you.  Such a great highball!  Positive holds and big feet with every move.  Stand start with L fingers in obvious pocket.  Head straight up to the exit.  The mantle feels very exposed as there aren't any holds over the lip, but it's quite easy.
content.protection: No amount of pads are going to save you if you fall from the top of this.
content.location: Castle area.  Obvious black face. The biggest boulder in the area and the route can easily be seen from the road.  See pic.

content.description: Sit Down Start right next to an old car hood, a couple of big moves take you right up this overhanging arete, top out pulls over to the right side of the arete for an easy finish.
content.location:
Anything But Bland Area

This problem is found about 50 yards south of the Anything But Bland Boulder and has an old car hood sitting next to this overhanging arete

content.description: Sit start.  Climb the arete on solid rock, without drifting onto the easy slab on your right.  At the top, "hug" your way over the last two blocks and top out.
content.location: NE corner of the Y Not boulder.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start on rock; left hand arete, right hand flake.  Bump up the flake and arete and then throw for a jug.  Bad feet makes for slightly hairy top-out.
content.location: Just south of the Circuit boulder.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start with some footjams.  Layback and jam up the crack and top out the boulder.  Crux is the start.
content.location: East side of BBC boulder, in the Lighthouse area. See pic.

content.description: Sit start.  L hand crack, R hand 2 finger pocket(the socket).  Throw for the jug, pull up and mantle.  Basically following the line of the crack.  Feet for the start are hard to figure out.
content.location: East face of Circuit boulder. See pic.

content.description: Name says it all; not great but she'll get the job done.  Sit start.  Work up flake with toe and heelhooks.  When flake ends, throw to the lip and top out.  Still dirty.
content.location: Circuit area.  Just NE of Red River boulder.

content.description: Sit start on lowest rail, left of Monochorionic. Head directly up the overhanging arete, on jugs, to the top.  Difficult downclimb.
content.location: Climb Northeast arete of Red River boulder, in Circuit area

content.description: Stand start with right on hand on the arete, left hand on a small under cling. Slap up the blunt arete, using a cool shallow pocket for your left hand. Gain some good holds, then make a high reach with small feet to top out.
content.location: In the Circuit area, the vertical arete seen on the pretty orange and black streaked boulder adjacent to Baby Jams. Labeled in Farnsworth's Mini-Guide Circuit topo as #11, Dave's Arete.

content.description: Sit start on good flake.  Work up thin flake to top out.
content.location: Warmup area.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start on rail.  Gather feet and throw to the lip and top out.  *Lady beta: there's a nice undercling beneath the lip.
content.location: West face of Circuit boulder. See pic.

content.description: Easy camp side lap problem starting low.
content.location: West face.

content.description: Clean arete with terrible feet.
content.location: Northwest corner of Camp Side Boulder.

content.description: Sit start lower left arete.  Climb right towards apex.
content.location: Right trending face.

content.description: Climb the East arete of the slab.  Easiest route to the top.
content.location: The Warmup area.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start.  Work up overhanging huecos and jugs.  The rocks around you are off, for feet, if you want to keep the grade. Really fun!
content.location: The corridor behind the Warmup Area, where the down climb is.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start as for Y Not. When you get to the good ledge, trend left and head up the crack filled with "books" and top out.
content.location: Just left of Y Not.  See pic.

content.description: This beautiful face has waited far too long for a FA.  If it were in Joes or Kraft boulders, there would be a line waiting to devour it's highball goodness. Hug your way up the skinny, black face with heelhooks and toehooks to the heart pounding finish.  The finish is easy with all jugs but almost guaranteed to make you pee a little.  You can also cheat and step around the left corner onto a flake and skip the mantle but that's for wimps.  Best route in the area!
content.protection: Pads, but you better not fall
content.location: In the Lighthouse area.  Just a few feet from YNot.  You cant miss it.

content.description: If you are looking for your first highball, make it this one.  Sit start, then walk up the axe edge arete on big holds and feet.  The more you stay on the arete proper, the greater the fun.  If you're a wimp, you can climb the slab left of the arete and skip all the exposurey goodness of the arete.  But why would you do that?! Guaranteed to leave a smile on your face.  Best V0 in Blanding!
content.location: Castle area, the northeast arete of the Iron Maiden boulder.  See pic.

content.description: Sit start on open face behind trees.
content.location: South face hidden behind trees.

content.description: Sit start.  Climb finger and thin hands crack.  No holds can be used except the crack if you want to keep the grade!  Jam your way to the top for an easy top out.
content.location: Circuit area, just east of Circuit Breaker boulder. See pic.

content.description: Sit start.  Climb the easy cracks to an easy top out.
content.location: Middle of Warmup area.  See pic.

content.description:
For those days when you would rather be anywhere but a podunk little town in the Utah desert that doesnt have coffee or booze.  This awesome traverse is the epitome of power endurance.  Two great problems for the price of one?!  Can't be beat.

- Right to Left. Stand start on the slopey triangle jug at the end of the rail.  Throw a heel and start cranking.  You will eventually reach a point at the finish where it's almost impossible not to drag.  Find a L foot under the rail, right at the end of the problem, and mantle up onto the face to finish at the arete.  Continue up Free Hugs to the top if you want to top out.  Hint: a few sneaky heel-toe cams will save you if you can use them. V4ish

- Left to right.  Sit start at the arete and start working left.  You transition to horizontal right before the boot shaped jug and start working down the rail.  Instead of finishing at the end of the rail, you are going to head up the crack.  Big power moves off of the rail will help you get onto the face.  Continue up crack to the top of the boulder.  V5ish
content.location: The north face of the Anything but Bland boulder.  See pics

content.description: Start on a crimpy rail about eye level, moving up and left to a deep three finger pocket is the coolest and hardest move. Then move up and right through more pockets and easier climbing to the top of this gently overhanging face.
content.location:
Anything But Bland Area

Left side of the beautiful gently overhanging face. Starts on crimpy rail about eye level.

content.description: Sit start.  Get a foot jam and start climbing the left trending finger crack.  Sink some good foot jams about 1/2 way up and throw for the jugs.  Easy top out.
content.location: Straight south of the Circuit boulder.  See pic.

content.description: Right arete with dirty, positive holds.
content.location: Right arete of Aemon boulder.

content.description: Straight up center requiring body english on big ledges.
content.location: Southeast center face of Aemon boulder.
